titleStmt.title: By the King a proclamation prohibiting the importation of purles, cutworkes, and bonelaces, made in forraine parts, and for the sealing of such as are made within the realme of England and dominion of Wales.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie: And by the Assignes of Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: Announcing grant of the office of sealer to Thomas Smith, giving his address.
"Giuen at Our Honour of Hampton Court the thirtieth day of September, in the eleuenth yeere of Our Reigne."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
